name: Sedum
description: Sedum, commonly known as Stonecrop, is a large genus of succulent plants  in the Crassulaceae family, distributed through the Northern hemisphere with only a few species native to Southern hemisphere. The genus contains about 500 species of annuals, evergreen or deciduous perennials and subshrubs.Most species have attractive, fleshy leaves and beautiful, star-shaped flowers. Sedums thrive in rock gardens, around stones or alongside pathways and structures, and come in a variety of colors and forms.
meaning: The genus name is derived from the Latin word “sedeo” (“to sit”), because they sit and sprawl over rocks.
color_description: The flowers come in a rainbow of colors, from red, orange, pink and purple to yellow and white. The foliage can be found in different colors, too.
